meanings.sent1: The toddler totters as he learns to walk.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge totters in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The stack of books totters on the edge of the table.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence totters after receiving the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The vase totters on the narrow shelf, ready to fall.

meanings.definition: Shake or wobble as if about to fall
meanings.sent1: The loose tooth totters when she eats.
meanings.sent2: The tower of blocks totters before collapsing.
meanings.sent3: The tired dog totters on its paws after a long walk.
meanings.sent4: The old chair totters under the weight of the man.
meanings.sent5: The top-heavy tree totters in the strong breeze.

meanings.definition: Be on the verge of collapse
meanings.sent1: The economy totters due to the recent crisis.
meanings.sent2: The old building totters from years of neglect.
meanings.sent3: The tired athlete totters at the end of the race.
meanings.sent4: The relationship totters after the argument.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out bridge totters under the heavy traffic.
